snippet: The lawyers were charged after they shouted insults at a senior police official who shares the first name of a historical figure and companion of the Prophet Muhammad.
abstract: Group of 68 Pakistani lawyers are charged with blasphemy after anti-police protest; blasphemy cases have become more frequent in Pakistan, often in absurd circumstances, underscoring how a law intended to protect against religious intolerance has become a tool of bigotry.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Declan Walsh from London. Waqar Gillani contributed reporting from Lahore, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The lawyers were charged after they shouted insults at a senior police official who shares the first name of a historical figure and companion of the Prophet Muhammad.

headline.main: 68 Pakistani Lawyers Are Charged With Blasphemy After Protesting the Police
headline.print_headline: 68 Pakistani Lawyers Protesting Police Are Charged With Blasphemy
